arm_group.description: Study stool recipient's will receive approximately 30 grams of processed donor stool through a tube into their stomach for the transplant.

brief_summary.textblock:
In this study, the investigators want to see if Bacteriotherapy (also referred to as stool
      transplantation) improves the symptoms and decreases inflammation in children with
      Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD). Examples of IBD are Crohn's Disease and Ulcerative
      Colitis. Additionally, researchers want to learn whether this experimental therapy delays
      the need for starting additional medications to treat pediatric IBD.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bacteriotherapy in Pediatric Inflammatory Bowel Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children ages 12-21 years old with a diagnosis of mild to moderate Ulcerative Colitis
             or Crohn's Disease

          -  Willing parent to donate stool for the transplant

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Severe Disease

          -  History of intra-abdominal abscess, intra-abdominal fistula or stricturing

          -  History of other systemic diseases

          -  The patient has received TNF inhibitors to treat their IBD within two months of
             transplant

clinical_study.official_title: Bacteriotherapy in Pediatric Inflammatory Bowel Disease

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome measure is based on estimating the responder rate. This is defined as the proportion of patients with response to therapy by a drop of 10 or more points in PUCAI/PCDAI scoring.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
